column5: Anyone plan on going. I don't anticipate much from it. Surprised it's 3 days actually.
Not a bad little show. Went last year. Was free.
~~~Hit the show last year, and will be there again on Saturday. Enjoyed it
Its one of the better shows IMO. Some great deals and free entry. I'm going to try and swing by, but I have plans to fish, so it will be tight.   S.
Not sure what everyone is talking about, I was there last year. Its very expensive just like most other shows if not more. Not many deals at all, if that's what you are looking for.
its ok for the area and a great spot to see some fishing buddies and chat....some products there and it was a decent way to spend a few hours....
Handlebars had some good deals on muskie spinner baits.  Some other interesting attractions.  I might stop in after work on Friday.  I think it's rare to find deals at shows.

Handlebars had some good deals on muskie spinner baits.  Some other interesting attractions.  I might stop in after work on Friday.  I think it's rare to find deals at shows. I was thinking the same. I went last year and got a nice set of glasses for $70 when he was asking $100.  I only offered $70 as that's all I had left and I was okay if I didn't get them but he said sure. FYI: This year is $7 per adult.  Last year was free as it was a last minute thing thrown together from the folks that do the TO Sportsman show.  This year should be good too even if it cost's $7 to park and check out the show.
If you see a guy with a white and black WFN hat on the odds are its me so say hi
I think I saw that it is free if you have an up to date OFAH membership card with you. Don't quote me on that though.
Go see Tony and load up on Beaver Lures!!!!

was there today, not bad some good deals to be had, some good products on display, now thinking of a basscat instead of a another ranger, pantera2 much better deal than a 185 ranger came home with some alabama rigs ofah members get in free
Well ended buying a bunch of lures, haha. Decent little show.
